## Introduction
Oven Roasted Garlic Bread is a delicious and aromatic side dish that complements a wide range of meals. The combination of crispy bread and flavorful roasted garlic creates a mouthwatering experience. This recipe is a classic favorite and is popular in Italian cuisine.

## Ingredients
- 1 loaf of French bread
- 4-6 cloves of garlic, minced
- 1/2 cup (1 stick) unsalted butter, softened
- 2 tablespoons fresh parsley, chopped
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon black pepper

## Equipment
- Baking sheet
- Aluminum foil
- Mixing bowl
- Knife
- Cutting board
- Oven

## Preparation Time
- 10 minutes

## Cooking Time
- 15 minutes

## Steps
1. Preheat the oven to 375째F (190째C).
2. Cut the French bread loaf in half lengthwise.
3. In a mixing bowl, combine the minced garlic, softened butter, chopped parsley, salt, and black pepper. Mix well until all the ingredients are evenly incorporated.
4. Spread the garlic butter mixture evenly on the cut sides of the French bread.
5. Place the bread halves on a baking sheet lined with aluminum foil, cut side up.
6. Place the baking sheet in the preheated oven and bake for about 15 minutes, or until the bread is golden brown and crispy.
7. Remove from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
8. Slice the bread into individual servings and serve warm.

## Serving Suggestions
- Oven Roasted Garlic Bread is a perfect accompaniment to pasta dishes such as spaghetti, lasagna, or fettuccine Alfredo.
- It also pairs well with soups and stews, adding a flavorful crunch to your meal.
- Serve it as an appetizer with a side of marinara sauce for dipping.

## Variations
- Cheesy Garlic Bread: Sprinkle shredded mozzarella or Parmesan cheese on top of the garlic butter before baking for a cheesy twist.
- Herb-infused Garlic Bread: Add dried Italian herbs such as oregano, basil, or thyme to the garlic butter mixture for an extra burst of flavor.
- Spicy Garlic Bread: Add a pinch of red pepper flakes or a dash of hot sauce to the garlic butter for a spicy kick.

## Tips and Tricks
- Make sure the butter is softened to room temperature for easy mixing and spreading.
- Adjust the amount of garlic according to your preference. You can add more or less depending on how strong you want the garlic flavor to be.
- For a crispier crust, you can broil the bread for a couple of minutes after baking.
- Leftover garlic bread can be stored in an airtight container at room temperature for up to 2 days. Reheat in the oven for a few minutes to restore its crispiness.

## Storage and Leftovers
- Leftover garlic bread can be stored in an airtight container at room temperature for up to 2 days.
- To reheat, place the bread in a preheated oven at 350째F (175째C) for about 5 minutes, or until warmed through.

## Frequently Asked Questions
- Can I use other types of bread for this recipe?
  - Yes, you can use other types of bread such as Italian bread, ciabatta, or baguette. Adjust the baking time as needed.
- Can I make the garlic butter in advance?
  - Yes, you can make the garlic butter in advance and store it in the refrigerator. Let it come to room temperature before spreading it on the bread.
- Can I freeze the garlic bread?
  - It is not recommended to freeze the garlic bread as the texture may change upon thawing. It is best enjoyed fresh.
